title: CNN's Going Green explores the innovations protecting and purifying water - PR Newswire
summary: This article summarizes several innovations that are protecting and purifying water around the world. These innovations include a new way to study shark populations, a solar-powered desalination solution, a system for recycling wastewater in buildings, a method for turning agricultural waste into a water filtration medium, and a way to convert toxic algae waste into plastics. All of these innovations have the potential to make a significant positive impact on the environment.
green_innovation: TRUE, because all of the innovations described in the article contribute to environmental sustainability goals by reducing water pollution, conserving water resources, or improving water quality.
business_innovation: TRUE, because all of the innovations described in the article are new or improved products or processes that differ significantly from the companies' previous offerings and have been introduced on the market or brought into use by the firms.
green_product: TRUE, because all of the products described in the article are designed to reduce their environmental impact throughout their life cycle by using environmentally friendly materials, minimizing energy consumption and waste, and supporting recycling and low environmental impact during usage and disposal.
green_process: TRUE, because all of the processes described in the article are designed to minimize environmental impacts and promote sustainability by reducing waste, conserving natural resources, decreasing energy consumption, and limiting the release of harmful substances into the environment.

title: Sustainable Shoes: 13 Brands Creating Planet-Friendly Footwear - Pebble Magazine
summary: Sustainable footwear encompasses eco-friendly materials, ethical manufacturing, and closed-loop systems. Leading brands prioritize renewable resources, recycled materials, and responsible sourcing. This article highlights 13 brands offering a wide range of sustainable shoe options, from vegan sneakers to recycled plastic flats.

title: New lithium discovery highlights why we never run out of resources - Yield PRO magazine
summary: Technical forecasts of resource availability are biased towards doom and gloom because they underestimate the availability of resources and the rate of consumption. The discovery of a new lithium deposit is an example of how resources appear to stay barely ahead of short-term consumption needs, but in reality, businesses will search for new reserves when they start to run out. As resources become more scarce, prices rise, which forces consumers to economize and companies to create new substitutes.
greenwashing: The article does not provide enough information to determine if the described innovation is an example of greenwashing.

title: Victoriaâ€™s New Recycling Scheme Is Serving Us Utopian Slay - The Latch
summary: Victoria's Container Deposit Scheme (CDS Vic) launched on November 1, 2023, offering a 10-cent refund for every can, carton, and bottle returned to designated collection zones. The scheme aims to reduce litter, promote recycling, and create jobs.
green_innovation: TRUE, as the CDS Vic scheme promotes recycling, reduces litter, and aims to divert 80% of materials from landfill by 2030.
business_innovation: TRUE, as the Reverse Vending Machines installed at Coles locations represent a new and improved method for recycling.
green_product: TRUE, as the CDS Vic scheme encourages the recycling of cans, cartons, and bottles, which can be transformed into new products.
green_process: TRUE, as the CDS Vic scheme promotes recycling, which reduces waste and conserves natural resources.
